reviews.review_msg: Morten is the best professor I have had in my entire life. He can teach, is generous towards students, and does know his material. I got an A with him, and going to his class every morning was a genuine pleasure. The fact he teaches development policy, and that his area of focus is Africa is heartening.
Perhaps the most interesting course I have ever taken, and Morten made it that way.  Be prepared to work, but he knows his stuff.

Great, prof, great lectures, though he can jump around a lit. No textbook for this class, however, there is a lot of online journal articles to read, especially near the end of the semester. Also, great TA for leading discussions afterwards. I learned a lot!

Professor Pang is educated and very well-read. Her lectures were highly enjoyable and informative and really shapes how you view capitalism and anti-capitalism. Reading responses are opportunities for easy marks and all major essays are scaled. Doesn't mark on the international studies' program's 5% scale is a plus! Overall loved the course!
If you want a course in order to understand this life and how the world works politically and economically, I recommend it. Deep readings and educated professor

She is a tough marker but she scales the grades so even if you don't do great on a paper it won't be reflected in your overall mark. There are weekly reading guide assignments that help with tutorials and are an easy grade booster. If you want an easy A this isn't the class for you, but if you want actually learn something it's for you.

She is extremely opinionated so the class does not feel like an independent place to learn but rather a place to learn her opinions. The workload is too much with two deadlines a week and four papers just for one class.

Contrary to others, I really liked him. He has very impressive credentials. Exams were long and VERY hands-on, with fill in the blanks, definition questions, multiple choice, long and short answer, essay and graph questions. A lot of the class was unable to finish. The term paper was easy & he was a lenient marker. Straight forward if you study.

The grade was made up of tutorial attendance, a midterm, a final, and 1 paper only, yet even with a TA, he has nothing marked on time despite constant promises. Heading into the final exam only knowing 30% of your grade is absurd. What got marked was pretty fair. A very nice guy though, understanding of personal issues and gave a short extension.

Do not ever take this professor. He is very confusing and rambles in lectures from topic to topic. It feel like he is not doing a lecture and feels more like he's just yapping to you about some stuff he finds interesting. This guy will give you a ton of readings. He wants a whole essay if you want full marks in the short answers part of his exams.

Very nice and knowledgeable. He is very passionate about his teachings but at times will go off on tangents and the lectures can feel quite long. Overall a great professor with straightforward mid-term and paper outlines. You are able to excel even if you skip lectures but make sure readings or done or you will struggle in the course.

I was initially scared to take one of Chris's classes. He ended up being my TA as well for the tutorial. He was super nice but a bit difficult to reach over email. The exams are quite hard but you'll do fine if you study. His exams are also graded on a curve. It is pretty boring content but the class is somewhat easy if you actually put the work in

Readings are extremely wordy and difficult to understand. Tutorials are alright for trying to break down and understand key concepts, but I would say it is dependent on your TA. The course feels like it has no cohesion whatsoever, with the course jumping topic to topic without really feeling like you've understood what was discussed before.

Lots of reading for this class (about 3 readings that were 20+ pages each per week) that were quite dry, many also having noticeable bias. First half of course was harder and more boring, second half was better. Final was a second midterm. Lectures had a lot of rambling but tutorials did help clarify some ideas. Overall he was a nice guy though.

Some people didn't get their midterm grades back till a week before the final, essay grades didn't come out before the final despite a promise to do so. Some final questions were nothing like what was discussed in class. Rambles a lot in lectures, essay topic was extremely unclear with no rubric to follow. An overall mess of time management.

AVOID, I will not take any upper divs taught by him. He rambles a LOT, it is very hard to ask him questions if you are confused because his answers are as confusing as whatever you are confused about. he returns grades extremely slowly and is spotty on replying to emails. also, VERY dense and long readings, usually 3/week
Great proff. Quirky, but really cares and is very knowledgable. I would def take her upper divclasses if i can

Enjoyed my class with Professor Armijo. She definitely knows her stuff and lectures are well put together. I learned a lot from this class. She cares a lot about her students and it shows. I found the marking pretty easy and the workload managable (participation + midterm + 3 essays). I'd take a class with her again

Interesting and thorough lectures, she genuinely wants us to learn and engage with the material so maybe some students who don't feel passionate about the topics wouldn't do well. Whenever I have time, I go to her office hours and talk to her for an hour and a half, she's very welcoming, insightful, and open to discuss and listen.

She will never be able to tell you why you got the grade you got, so you can't fight for it. Her lectures are pretty boring and you can def miss them, but not the tutorials. Lots of writing assignments. Textbooks aren't awful, but some were pretty bad and boring.
Goes on rants that are completely irrelevant, but she cares. Talk to her about literally anything, she is sweet. But not a good prof.
Clear exams that are easy to do half decent on, very approachable and passionate.
As mentioned,kind and knowledgeable professor - but unclear expectations and very difficult to achieve high marks because of this

Leslie's knowledgeable. She's super available, so go to her office hours! She has unclear and confusing expectations. Midterm average was a B-, paper average C+. Treated us as a 4th-year students. Lectures can get boring. She grades exams as a whole but not like one point per answer. HARD MARKER. If you're aiming for an A, it will be really hard!
